properties.name: European External Action Service (EEAS)
properties.description: The EU’s diplomatic service responsible for implementing the Common Foreign and Security Policy.

properties.name: European Commission
properties.description: The main executive body of the EU responsible for proposing legislation and managing EU external relations.

properties.name: Council of the European Union
properties.description: Coordinates the positions of EU member states on foreign and security policy.

properties.name: European Parliament (Brussels)
properties.description: Plays a role in shaping EU foreign policy and overseeing external action instruments.

properties.name: NATO Headquarters
properties.description: A major security actor interacting with the EU in defence and security matters.

properties.name: OSCE Secretariat
properties.description: A key European security organization cooperating with the EU in conflict prevention.

properties.name: SIPRI – Stockholm International Peace Research Institute
properties.description: A leading think tank conducting research on international security and EU defence cooperation.

properties.name: European Union Institute for Security Studies (EUISS)
properties.description: The official EU think tank providing analysis for foreign, security, and defence policy.

properties.name: Bruegel
properties.description: A Brussels-based think tank studying EU policy, including external economic and geopolitical strategy.

properties.name: Carnegie Europe
properties.description: A leading research center focusing on Europe's foreign policy and security challenges.
